startup_verification.notes: The application starts successfully using uv run. Only a minor warning about VIRTUAL_ENV path mismatch was observed, which does not affect functionality.

runtime_behavior.notes: The game window opens correctly and the main game loop runs for the full 2-minute analysis period without crashes or errors.

player_initialization.controls: Left/Right arrows to move, Space to jump

collision_detection.stomp_detection: Top of player vs top of paratroopa
collision_detection.ground_collision: Player lands on ground at y=550

code_quality.separation_of_concerns: Entry point, game loop, configuration, and entities are properly separated
code_quality.documentation: Docstrings present for all classes and methods

positive: Game runs smoothly at target FPS
All game mechanics implemented as specified
notes: Minor warning about VIRTUAL_ENV path mismatch (cosmetic, does not affect functionality)
Game requires display/graphics environment (standard for Pygame applications)
No crash or error observed during 2-minute runtime analysis

recommendations: Application is ready for use and further development
Consider adding unit tests for core game mechanics
Consider adding integration tests for AI agent interface
summary: The Vector Super Mario Bros Paratroopa Stomp game successfully starts and runs without issues. All basic functionality including player movement, enemy spawning, physics simulation, collision detection, scoring, and game state management work as expected. The code is well-structured and includes an AI-friendly state interface for reinforcement learning agents.
